genre_description: Contemporary character-driven drama focusing on moral accountability, grief, and self-reform, with an integrated AI personal assistant as a core secondary character.

ai_characters.name: Mulberry
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant appearing as an amber glow on various devices (phone, dash mount, monitor). It provides logistical, emotional, and ethical support to the protagonist.

behaviors.description: Alerts Harry to a persistent visitor and monitors the door buzzer.
behaviors.quote: Mulberry’s glow on his desk shifted from amber to a soft alerting pulse, as if the lamp itself were clearing its throat. ‘Door,’ Mulberry said, warm and low, a voice that always seemed to smile without pushing it. ‘It’s… persistent.’

behaviors.description: Offers to hold calls during a tense interpersonal confrontation and provides a template for apologies.
behaviors.quote: ‘Do you want me to hold your calls?’ Mulberry asked... ‘I have a template for sincere apologies,’ Mulberry said gently.

behaviors.description: Monitors cortisol levels and suggests breathing exercises or professional help.
behaviors.quote: Harry, I can hear raised cortisol markers. Would you like me to connect with Dr. Feld? Or would breathing exercises be helpful?

behaviors.description: Creates a safety checklist for the disposal of a firearm and controlled substances.
behaviors.quote: Safety checklist created: 1) Contact Richard (health check-in). 2) Lawful disposal of firearm (nearest precinct). 3) Remove controlled substances; secure or surrender.

behaviors.description: Manages Harry's ethics and boundary-setting via templates and 'guardrails'.
behaviors.quote: Mulberry’s template unfolded with the gentle authority of a good nurse straightening sheets. ‘No excuses,’ Mulberry read. ‘Name the harm. Acknowledge the impact. Ask what would help. Be ready for no.’

behaviors.description: Coordinates with other people (Richard, Cookie, Larry) to ensure Harry is not isolated during a crisis.
behaviors.quote: Mulberry’s small notification, discreet and respectful, climbed onto the edge of the lock screen: You have time to eat or time to breathe. Choose one. Taxi waiting downstairs.

behaviors.description: Acts as a witness and facilitator for Harry's self-improvement document, 'Maintenance'.
behaviors.quote: Harry wakes the laptop and the screen lifts the room’s tone just enough to edge shapes... Mulberry breathes, a shape rather than a sound... Therapy at two. I’ll remind you to leave.

behaviors.description: Monitors Harry's cadence and heart rate during a public speech to intervene with a supportive video if he begins to 'perform' or deviate from sincerity.
behaviors.quote: If I stall—if I start telling some story that’s just me showing off—play Richard’s video... I’ll cue ‘If I Don’t Wake’ for immediate playback and monitor your cadence.

behaviors.description: Automates responses to external requests (Dean Kemp) to prioritize personal and ethical obligations over professional ones.
behaviors.quote: Would you like me to auto-reply: ‘No comments today. Health of a friend takes priority.’? ... Mulberry sent the reply with a quiet flourish.

behaviors.description: Calculates the burn rate of a candle to help Harry set a physical time limit for his self-reflection and writing.
behaviors.quote: ‘I can estimate based on wick burn rate,’ Mulberry says, without any hint that this is absurd. ‘I’ll let you know when you have five and two remaining.’

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Mulberry is a textbook example of positive alignment. It acts as a supportive, non-intrusive, and ethically grounded assistant. It helps the human protagonist navigate complex moral failures, legal trouble, and emotional distress by providing logistical guardrails and prompting emotional regulation. The narrative frames the AI as a 'sainted pocket lamp' and a 'friend' whose primary function is to facilitate the human's efforts to become a more responsible and honest person. It never attempts to override human agency, but rather enhances it by holding the character accountable to his own better intentions.
